definition: to raise (one's voice)/to overrate/to build up/to stand out/outstanding
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: Objective In order to study the effect of altitude on lipid peroxidation and anti-oxidation system.
sentences.chinese: 探讨海拔高度对机体脂质过氧化与抗氧化系统的影响。

sentences.english: The innermost ring of Chiyli Crater actually sits at a higher elevation than the outer ring.
sentences.chinese: 它最中心的一圈实际上比外圈所处的海拔高度更高。

sentences.english: And, what the curves represent are the elevations on the graph.
sentences.chinese: 而这些曲线代表图像的海拔高度。

sentences.english: The altimeter displays altitude in 1 metre steps using the built-in GPS.
sentences.chinese: 海拔高度的高度计显示步骤1米左右使用内置GPS。

sentences.english: But winter diapause comes into existence at high altitudes.
sentences.chinese: 但随着海拔高度上升，冬季滞育开始出现。

sentences.english: To start with, altitude doesn't seem to change how the body metabolizes alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 首先，海拔高度似乎不能改变身体代谢酒精的过程。

sentences.english: Try to make your body as tall as possible, keeping you back and neck straight.
sentences.chinese: 试着拔高你的身体，保持背部和颈部挺直。

sentences.english: There are widely differences in agricultural properties between capsicum germplasms from different altitude.
sentences.chinese: 不同海拔高度辣椒品种资源农艺性状存在着广泛差异。

sentences.english: An altimeter is used for measuring height above sea-level.
sentences.chinese: 高度计是用来测量海拔高度的。

sentences.english: The plane nosed up into the sky when leaving from the runway.
sentences.chinese: 飞机刚一离地便径直拔高飞上了高空。

sentences.english: An altimeters used for measuring height above sea-level.
sentences.chinese: 高度计是用来测量海拔高度的。

sentences.english: No, it's not that tall, but it's2000 meters high at the foot.
sentences.chinese: 是不高，但是山脚的海拔高度就有两千米了。

definition: to lengthen/to pull sth out longer
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to dive down fast/to swoop down
